text: Hi folks, Derek Green here. I'm a PhD candidate in toxicology in central Canada. My research involves pharmaco/toxicokinetic modeling and I'm hoping to use Julia to derive intercompartmental flux rate constants and simulate dose regimes.

elements.text: Hi folks, Derek Green here. I'm a PhD candidate in toxicology in central Canada. My research involves pharmaco/toxicokinetic modeling and I'm hoping to use Julia to derive intercompartmental flux rate constants and simulate dose regimes.

text: Oh this is cool. I did my PhD in entomology and had some dose-response experiments with pesticides. At the time I used R for analysis, but I eventually transferred some stuff to Julia as an exercise. This was couple years ago and I don't so that type of research anymore, but I'm still interested. I've been trying to have something like the drm R package done in Julia.
